text:
I use mass virtual hosting (name based) and basicly my httpd.conf looks
something like:

# - LOGGING - #
LogFormat "%h %l %u %t \"%r\" %>s %b \"%{Referer}i\" \"%{User-Agent}i\"" combined
LogFormat "%h %l %u %t \"%r\" %>s %b"                                    common
LogFormat "%{Referer}i -> %U"                                            referer
LogFormat "%{User-agent}i"                                               agent
LogFormat '"%r" %{outstream}n/%{instream}n (%{ratio}n%%)'                deflate

ErrorLog "|/usr/sbin/cronolog /var/log/httpd/error_log-%Y-%m-%d"
LogLevel warn

# - VIRTUAL HOSTS -
LogFormat           "%V %h %l %u %t \"%r\" %s %b"                       vcommon
CustomLog           "|/usr/sbin/cronolog /dirxyz/xyz/access_log-%Y-%m-%d" vcommon
UseCanonicalName    Off
VirtualDocumentRoot /xyz/zyxdir/%0/html
VirtualScriptAlias  /xyz/zyxdir/%0/cgi-bin
# - VIRTUAL HOSTS -

This works ok. All virtual hosts activity is logged to one file.

Now i made a new virtual host using <VirtualHost> -directive:
<VirtualHost somesite.somedomain.fi>
ServerAdmin admin@somewhere.com
DocumentRoot /xyz/zyxdir/somesite.somedomain.fi/html
ServerName somesite.somedomain.fi
ErrorLog "|/usr/sbin/cronolog /zyx/chrdir/home/account/logs/error_log-%Y-%m-%d"
CustomLog           "|/usr/sbin/cronolog
/xyz/chrdir/home/account/logs/somedomain_access_log-%Y-%m-%d" common
</VirtualHost>

Problem is that somedomain_access_log is getting other virtual domain activities
 too not just this virtual host, but documentation says that
customlog/transferlog under virtualhost-directive should only get that
virtualhost's logs.

Is problem related because i am using:
VirtualDocumentRoot /xyz/zyxdir/%0/html
VirtualScriptAlias  /xyz/zyxdir/%0/cgi-bin

Any ideas?
creator: pekka.panula@sofor.fi

text: When the first <virtualhost was added, it started handling all the requests formerly handled by the base configuration.  Virtual* is not a real virtualhost.
creator: covener@gmail.com
